alert.note: Alert for Bent; Kiowa; Prowers (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 06 at 11:28PM MDT until July 07 at 2:00AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Bent County in southeastern Colorado... Central Kiowa County in southeastern Colorado... Western Prowers County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 200 AM MDT. * At 1128 PM MDT, At 11:30 pm, doppler radar estimated 2 to 4 inches of rain has fallen over Kiowa county, with the heaviest rain occurring in the vicinity of Eads. Over Prowers county, 1 to 3 inches of rain has fallen. Street flooding has been reported in Lamar. Heavy rain will still be possible across Prowers county through the early morning hours, but the heavy should come to an end prior to midnight across Kiowa county. Please do not dry in area where water covers the roadway. Travel in and around central Kiowa count and Prowers county, especially northern Prowers county may be difficult to impossible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lamar, Eads, Wiley, Haswell, McClave, Hasty, Neegronda Reservoir, John Martin Reservoir, Sweetwater Reservoir, Queens Reservoir, Neeoshe Reservoir, Blue Lake, Caddoa and Fort Lyon. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
